Context:
Program Name: Computer Systems Technician
Code: T141
Credential: Ontario College Diploma
Duration: 2 years (4 semesters)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,302.00
International Tuition: $18,350.00
Program Location: Casa Loma Campus
Related Programs: Computer Systems Technology (T147), Computer Programming and Analysis (T177), Cyber Security (Postgraduate) (T433)
Courses: Not specified in the given text.
Program Description: The Computer Systems Technician program provides a broad and in-depth technical base through courses in system support, network administration, and web technologies. Students will have strong administration, troubleshooting, and design skills upon graduation. The IT sector is growing in Toronto and has reported skills shortages; graduates of this program are prepared to write several industry certification exams and fulfill the demand for skilled employees in this field.
Industry Partnership: The college supports over 35 other Cisco Networking Academies, is one of only a few academies with Instructor Trainer status, and has won the Premier Partner status for two years in a row for contributions to student and instructor success.

Context:
The college offers a Computer Systems Technician program with both on-campus and online formats. Students in the on-campus program use NetLab platform for hands-on installation, configuration, and troubleshooting skills on Cisco Systems' physical equipment. The program requires students to have a personal computer with specifications including 16 GB RAM minimum, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive, Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better processor, Video card with 2GB RAM minimum/4GB RAM recommended, and a webcam.

Career options for graduates include establishing, operating, maintaining, and coordinating the use of local and wide area networks (LANs and WANs), software services, and related computer equipment. They set up and maintain Internet and Intranet websites and web-server technologies and monitor and optimize network connectivity and performance. They are employed in Information Technology units throughout the private and public sectors, with supervisors of computer network technicians also included in this group.

Students have opportunities to receive transfer credits toward further study to attain a degree. The program includes courses such as COMP 1151: IT Essentials, COMP 1236: Fundamentals of Computing Logic, COMP 1234: Introduction To Web Development, COMP 1176: Introduction to Networks, and COMP 3044: Linux Essentials in the first year. In the second year, students take courses such as COMP 3105: Enterprise Desktop Operating Systems and COMP 3136: Network Infrastructure.

Students starting the program in January (winter term) may be required to attend classes during the summer months (May to August). Please note that there is also a Computer Systems Technician Program (Online) available for those who prefer a distance learning format.

Context:
Program Offered: Computer System Administration and DevOps
Semesters: Up to at least Semester 4
Courses:
- COMP 2064: Identity Management Services
- COMP 2155: Network Automation
- COMP 2148: Professional Workplace Competencies
- COMP 3066: Linux System Administration
- COMP 3138: Enterprise Networking and Automation
- COMP 2102: Wireless Technology Fundamentals
- COMP 2141: Windows Server Network Infrastructure
- COMP 2156: DevOps For System Administration
- COMP 3061: Cyber Security Fundamentals
- COMM 1000 (Optional): Introduction to College Communication

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Identify, analyze, develop, implement, verify and document the requirements for a computing environment.
- Contribute to diagnostics, troubleshooting, documenting and monitoring of technical problems using appropriate methodologies and tools.
- Implement and maintain secure computing environments.
- Implement robust computing system solutions through validation testing that aligns with industry best practices.
- Communicate and collaborate with team members and stakeholders to ensure effective working relationships.
- Select and apply strategies for personal and professional development to enhance work performance.
- Adhere to ethical, legal and regulatory requirements in the development and management of computing solutions and systems.
- Assist with implementation of computer systems.
- Install, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, upgrade and decommission computing system infrastructures.
- Automate routine tasks using scripting tools and programming languages.
- Provide technical support for computing system infrastructures that aligns with industry best practice.
- Implement the basic concept, principles, and scope of DevOps.
- Apply task automation using configuration management and the Cloud.
- Automate network administrative tasks across distributed clients.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,302.00
- International Tuition: $18,350.00

Note: Amounts listed are estimated for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 and fees are subject to change.

Additional Costs: N/A (Text does not provide any information on additional costs)

- Course exemptions: College or university credits may qualify for course exemptions. Visit Transfer Guide for more information.
- Application process: Domestic students apply through Ontario Colleges, international students apply through George Brown College Online Application System.
